quiz.title: Economics: Production, Scale, and Government Budget

questions.question: Diminishing marginal returns occur when:
questions.explanation: Diminishing marginal returns (law of diminishing returns) means that adding more of a variable input, while holding other inputs fixed, eventually yields smaller increases in output (marginal product declines).

questions.question: Returns to scale relate to:
questions.explanation: Returns to scale describe how output changes when all inputs are increased proportionally in the long run.

questions.question: A budget deficit occurs when:
questions.explanation: A government budget deficit exists when total expenditures exceed total revenues (including taxes and other income) in a given period.

questions.question: Increasing returns to scale imply:
questions.explanation: Increasing returns to scale means that a proportional increase in all inputs leads to a more than proportional increase in output.
